spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches (left lounge/dining, left bedroom, central living/dining, bottom-left kitchen, right-side bedrooms, top bathrooms). However, several openings and facade elements do not align with the 2D plan: the bottom-left exterior access/porch connection is not represented as a door, multiple interior door positions are simplified into open passages, and several window runs/segmentations differ from the plan. Central living/dining reads proportionally larger than indicated, compressing adjacent circulation/room widths.

structural_fidelity.notes: Primary adjacencies are mostly correct (kitchen-to-living, living-to-right bedroom zone, bathrooms on top band). Structural detailing diverges: wall thickness is treated uniformly (interior/exterior not clearly differentiated), several doors are not embedded as doors (rendered as empty openings), and some small partition details (closet/utility-like subareas shown in 2D) are reduced/omitted. No clearly new full rooms are added, but some built-in partitions are lost.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture layouts are only partially faithful. The kitchen shows an island/bar-like element and seating arrangement that does not match the 2D plan’s table/counter arrangement. Some room furnishing counts/placements (living seating grouping, bedroom side furniture) are generic rather than mapped from the plan.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean, readable isometric-style presentation with coherent lighting and generally tidy geometry. However, it is not strictly orthographic (noticeable perspective), and some openings/windows read as simplified blocks rather than accurately modeled architectural elements, reducing technical clarity.

detected_errors.description: Bottom-left porch/exterior access shown in the 2D plan is not represented with a matching exterior door in the 3D render (appears as glazing/windows instead of a door).
Several interior door locations are shifted/simplified in 3D (rendered as open wall gaps), reducing fidelity to the 2D door placement positions.
Door orientation/swing information from the 2D plan is not preserved; openings in 3D do not reflect the specified hinged door orientations.
Window placement/segmentation differs on multiple exterior walls (e.g., long continuous window blocks in 3D where the 2D plan indicates separated window units/positions).
Room proportions are distorted: the central living/dining area appears oversized relative to adjacent rooms/corridors compared with the 2D plan.
Smaller partition/built-in elements suggested in the 2D (closet/utility-like subareas) are reduced or omitted in the 3D model.
Kitchen island/bar seating element appears added in 3D and does not match the 2D plan’s indicated kitchen furniture arrangement.
Render uses perspective rather than a strictly orthographic/isometric technical projection, slightly affecting measurement-like comparison.
